moves.1. e4 c5: My first annotation, I'm playing as black against tumble_weed in a team match.  The game starts out with myself playing Sicilian defense.
moves.2. d4: I have only played Sicilian a couple of times.  I like the way it plays out, but I had not yet seen this move.  It took me by surprise and I think led to an early disadvantage in the game.
moves.2... Nf6 3. Nc3 d6 4. dxc5 Nc6 5. cxd6 e: I let white take a couple of pawns before recapturing.
moves.6. Nf3 Be6 7. a3 g6 8. Ng5 Bg7: I set up the Dragon Variation.
moves.9. Nxe6 fxe6: My light squared bishop and white's strong side knight are exchanged.
moves.10. Bb5 O-O 11. Bxc6 bxc6: After two exchanges, the two pawns around the center I lost early have been replaced.  I feel that this is a mistake by my opponent as I will control the center soon.
The center is mine, but let my queen get pinned between white's bishop and my rook.
A blunder by my opponent, I now have his other knight.
moves.19... Qxa4 20. Qd3 Bh6 21. b4 Ne4 22. c4: I don't feel that this was too sneaky as it took two turns to set up this fork.
moves.23. cxd5 Nxb1 24. Rxb1 cxd5 25. Qxd5+ Kh: Now being up in material, I'm trying to find a way to either get a mate in or trade down material to have an easier end game.
moves.28. b5 Qb6 29. Qe2 Bd4 30. Rf1 Qc5 31. a: The queens are gone, now I have whites two pawns in the a and b file to worry about.
moves.36. Kg1 Re8: Trying to keep white's rook from traveling too far, I set up a possible mate.
I could trade rooks here, but I am too afraid of those pawns in the a and b files.
From this position I am confident I can take a pawn!
